sen.j: 宇津木 六之丞（うつぎ ろくのじょう、文化 (元号)6年（1809年） - 文久2年10月27日 (旧暦)（1862年12月27日））は、幕末期の彦根藩士。
sen.e: Rokunojo UTSUGI (1809-December 27, 1862) is a feudal retainer of Hikone Domain in the end of Edo Period.
Rokunojo UTSUGI (1809-December 27, 1862) is a feudal retainer of Hikone Domain in the end of Edo Period.
Rokunojo UTSUGI (1809 - December 27, 1862) is a feudal retainer of Hikone Domain in the end of Edo Period.

sen.j: 彦根藩士古沢六右衛門の四男。
sen.e: He is the fourth son of the feudal retainer of Hikone Domain, Rokuemon FURUSAWA.
He is the fourth son of the feudal retainer of Hikone Domain, Rokuuemon FURUSAWA.
sen.cmt: ・用語集の用語検索で「六右衛門」だけ検索するとRokuuemonと出たので、ここでもそれに従い修正しました。
sen.e: He is the fourth son of the feudal retainer of Hikone Domain, Rokuuemon FURUSAWA.
His name is Kageyoshi.
His name is Kageyoshi.
His name is Kageyoshi.
His childhood name is Kageyoshi.
His childhood name is Tomeyoshi.
sen.cmt: ・原文と訳の名前が異なっていたので修正しました。読み方が定かではありませんが、用語集の用語検索で「留吉」を検索したところTomeyoshiと出たのでそれに従いました。
sen.e: His childhood name is Tomeyoshi.
He was born in Omi Province.
He was born in Omi Province.
He was born in Omi Province.

sen.j: 文政4年（1821年）宇津木景俊の養嗣子となり、350石の宇津木六之丞家を継ぐ。
sen.e: In 1821, he became the adopted heir of Kagetoshi UTSUKI, and took over the family of Rokunojo UTSUGI with 350 koku.
In 1821, he became the adopted heir of Kagetoshi UTSUKI, and took over the family of Rokunojo UTSUGI with 350 koku (an old unit showing volume [1 koku is about 180 liter]).
sen.cmt: ・kokuだけでは分かりにくいと思い、末尾にその説明を追加しました（用語集用語検索の「１石」を参考にしました）。
sen.e: In 1821, he became the adopted heir of Kagetoshi UTSUKI, and took over the family of Rokunojo UTSUGI with 350 koku (an old unit showing volume [1 koku is about 180 liter]).

sen.j: 文政10年（1827年）江戸へ出府し、藩主井伊直亮の使番取次となる。
sen.e: In 1827, he went to the capital, Edo, and became the toritsugi (an attendant who serves Shogun by informing of a visitor and convey the message) of tsukaiban (a person responsible for order and patrol in the battlefield) of Naoaki II who was the lord of domain.

In 1827, he went to the capital, Edo, and became the toritsugi (an attendant who serves Shogun by informing of a visitor and convey the message) of tsukaiban (a person responsible for order and patrol in the battlefield) of Naoaki II who was the lord of domain.

In 1827, he went to the capital, Edo, and became the toritsugi (an attendant who serves Shogun by informing of a visitor and convey the message) of tsukaiban (a person responsible for order and patrol in the battlefield) of Naoaki II who was the lord of domain.

sen.j: また在府中には梁川星巌と親交があったという。
sen.e: It is said that he had a friendship with Seigan YANAGAWA while he was in Edo.
It is said that he had a friendship with Seigan YANAGAWA while he was in Edo.
It is said that he had a friendship with Seigan YANAGAWA while he was in Edo.

sen.j: 天保5年（1834年）母衣役となったため彦根に帰る。
sen.e: In 1834, he went back to Hikone as his mother became 衣役.
sen.cmt: 一原文・一訳文の例外対処。母衣役→意味不明のため原文のままとしています。
sen.e: In 1834, he went back to Hikone as he became 母衣役.
sen.cmt: ・「母衣役」はネットで調べたところ母衣（ほろ）という軍装があるそうなので、それを司る役職のことではないかと思いました。http://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/%E6%AF%8D%E8%A1%A3
sen.e: In 1834, he went back to Hikone as he became 母衣役.

sen.j: 天保12年（1841年）物頭、弘化3年（1846年）表用人となる。
sen.e: In 1841, he became Monogashira (Miliary Commanders), and in 1846, he became 表用人.
sen.cmt: 一原文・一訳文の例外対処。表用人→意味不明のため原文のままとしています。
sen.e: In 1841, he became Monogashira (Military Commanders), and in 1846, he became 表用人.
sen.cmt: ・「表用人」はネットで調べたところ「用人」 (lord chamberlain)という役職の一つのようです。ただ定訳不明なので修正はしませんでした。http://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/%E7%94%A8%E4%BA%BA・Militaryのtypoがありました。
sen.e: In 1841, he became Monogashira (Military Commanders), and in 1846, he became 表用人.

sen.j: 一方で相模湾の海防のため相模国に1万4600石を宛がわれた。
sen.e: Meanwhile, 14,600 koku was given to Sagami Province for navy defense at Sagami gulf.
sen.cmt: 一原文・一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: Meanwhile, 14,600 koku was given to Sagami Province for navy defense at Sagami gulf.
Meanwhile, 14,600 koku was given to Sagami Province for navy defense at Sagami gulf.

sen.j: 後には相州詰長期守護として警備に当たった。
sen.e: Later, he took charge of security as the long-term shugo (provincial constable) of Soshu (Sagami Province in the Edo period).
sen.cmt: 一原文・一訳文の例外対処。相州詰長期守護→定訳不明のため→the long-term shugo (provincial constable) of Soshu (Sagami Province in the Edo period)と訳出しています。
sen.e: Later, he took charge of security as the long-term shugo (provincial constable) of Soshu (Sagami Province in the Edo period).
sen.cmt: ・「相州詰長期守護」について、翻訳者の方の解釈で問題ないと思います。
sen.e: Later, he took charge of security as the long-term shugo (provincial constable) of Soshu (Sagami Province in the Edo period).

sen.j: かねてより親交のあった井伊直弼が藩主を継ぎ、安政5年（1858年）直弼が幕府大老に就任すると、自身は藩の公用人となる。
sen.e: When Naosuke II, who had been having a relationship with him and took over the lord of domain, assumed the post of Tairo (chief minister) of bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun) in 1858, he became koyonin of the domain.
sen.cmt: 一原文・一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: When Naosuke II, who had been having a relationship with him and took over the lord of domain, assumed the post of Tairo (chief minister) of bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun) in 1858, he became koyonin of the domain.

When Naosuke II, who had been having a relationship with him and took over the lord of domain, assumed the post of Tairo (chief minister) of bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun) in 1858, he became koyonin of the domain.

sen.j: 安政五カ国条約締結のために長野主膳が外部情報を集める一方で、藩論をまとめるために奔走した。
sen.e: While Nagano Shuzen collected the external information for concluding five countries treaty in the Ansei era, he made a great effort to summarize the opinion of a domain people.
sen.cmt: 一原文・一訳文の例外対処。長野主膳→定訳不明のため→Nagano Shuzenと訳出しています。安政五カ国条約→定訳不明のため→five countries treaty in the Ansei era と訳しています。
sen.e: While Shuzen NAGANO collected the external information for concluding the Ansei Five-Power Treaties, he made a great effort to summarize the opinion of a domain people.
sen.cmt: ・「長野主膳」は用語集の用語検索にあったので修正しました。・「安政五カ国条約」は「安政の五カ国条約」として用語検索にありましたので修正しました。
sen.e: While Shuzen NAGANO collected the external information for concluding the Ansei Five-Power Treaties, he made a great effort to summarize the opinion of a domain people.

sen.j: 以後も長野らとともに将軍継嗣問題や安政の大獄の処理に活躍した。
sen.e: Afterwards, he played important roles in handling the friction caused between the two candidates for the 14th Shogun's post, Yoshinobu HITOTSUBASHI and Yoshitomi (the future Iemochi) TOKUGAWA ('Shogun keishi mondai' in Japanese) and in handling the issue of Ansei no Taigoku (suppression of extremists by the Shogunate).
Afterwards, he played an important role in handling the issues such as a problem of heir of Shogun and handling the issue of Ansei no Taigoku (suppression of extremists by the Shogunate).
sen.cmt: ・翻訳段階では将軍継嗣問題について詳細まで英訳されていますが原文ではそこまで触れていないので詳細部は削除しました。それに伴い、文章の表現も少し変わりました。
sen.e: Afterwards, he played an important role in handling the issues such as a problem of heir of Shogun and handling the issue of Ansei no Taigoku (suppression of extremists by the Shogunate).

sen.j: 安政7年（1860年）直弼が桜田門外の変で暗殺された後も藩主に就任した井伊直憲に引き続き側役として仕えた。
sen.e: After Naosuke was assassinated in the Sakuradamongai Incident in 1860, he took over the role of Sobayaku (Secretary) from Naonori II who assumed the post of the lord of domain.
sen.cmt: 一原文・一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: Even after Naosuke was assassinated in the Sakuradamongai Incident in 1860, he continued serving as a Sobayaku (Secretary) of Naonori II who assumed the post of the lord of domain.
sen.cmt: ・「宇津木は引き続き、藩主に就任した井伊直憲に仕えた」という意味だと思いましたので、文章を変更しました。
sen.e: Even after Naosuke was assassinated in the Sakuradamongai Incident in 1860, he continued serving as a Sobayaku (Secretary) of Naonori II who assumed the post of the lord of domain.

sen.j: 文久2年（1862年）藩論が尊皇攘夷に傾くと、長野らとともに彦根に捕えられて禁固、同年に処刑された。
sen.e: When the emphasis of opinion of a domain people was placed on Sonno Joi (slogan advocating reverence for the Emperor and the expulsion of foreigners) in 1862, he was captured and imprisoned in Hikone, together with Nagano and others, and was executed in the same year.
sen.cmt: 一原文・一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: When the emphasis of opinion of a domain people was placed on Sonno Joi (slogan advocating reverence for the Emperor and the expulsion of foreigners) in 1862, he was captured and imprisoned in Hikone, together with NAGANO and others, and was executed in the same year.
sen.cmt: ・長野は姓なので大文字に直しました。
sen.e: When the emphasis of opinion of a domain people was placed on Sonno Joi (slogan advocating reverence for the Emperor and the expulsion of foreigners) in 1862, he was captured and imprisoned in Hikone, together with NAGANO and others, and was executed in the same year.
